text: i covered the bosnian war between 1982
and 1995 and first met an iraq marriage
in belgrade in 1992 i walked into a very
smoky room or rooms in belgrade was
smoky at that time and there was
marriage in full Serbian uniform he was
smoking a cigarette he was in expansive
mood he was telling me about all the
terrible things inflicted on the Serbs
throughout history particularly by the
Croats and one of the peculiarities of
the buzz in war throughout was that the
Serbs were so with madej in the lead of
this so blinded by the historical
injustice is particularly during World
War Two that they believed rightly in
some instances had been perpetrated
against the Serbs but they couldn't see
that the fact that this time around they
were the main perpetrators rather than
the victims knowledge wouldn't hear
anything of the disappearance of Muslims
some 750,000 of whom were moved from
their homes in the first nine months of
the war tens of thousands of whom
disappeared he wouldn't admit any of
that he was completely blind to he would
accept no responsibility and he insisted
that Serbs were just fighting to stay on
land that had been Serbian throughout
history in the end he charmed many
people including many NATO generals
General Wesley Clark was famously
pictured beside him wearing a Serbian
army hat and he responded to the efforts
of NATO on the UN the confused effort of
NATO and the UN during three years by
being forceful nevertheless mud it
remained for many years a heroic figure
within Serbia and I think it took these
15 plus years for certain society to
become sufficiently stable for the
arrest of knowledge to be possible
without an explosion of that very
divided society
